perturbation.original_text: 1.2 "Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications" shall mean the specifications for the Services attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A, as it may be amended from time to time by mutual agreement of the parties, which agreement shall not be unreasonably withheld by either party; if and when the Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications are modified in accordance with Section 2.2 below, the parties shall initial the new Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications or amendments to the existing Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications, and immediately following the last initialing such new Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications or amendments shall automatically be deemed to supercede or supplement (as the case may be) Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 "Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications" shall mean guidelines that should be followed to the best of Inktomi's ability. These specifications are subject to change.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'Exhibit A' and the formal amendment process, the definition of 'Deployment, Hosting and Maintenance Specifications' becomes vague and unenforceable. This omission creates an in-text contradiction because later sections of the contract still refer to these 'Specifications' as if they have a defined, mutually agreed-upon content, when in fact their meaning is now ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: 2.7 Inktomi will assign two (2) full-time Inktomi employees exclusively dedicated to maintenance duties hereunder. Such employees are identified in Exhibit D attached hereto; and their replacements shall be subject to Microsoft's prior written approval (which approval Microsoft will not unreasonably withhold). Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Microsoft and Inktomi mutually agree in writing, additional Inktomi employees may be required to be assigned to maintenance duties hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.7 Inktomi will assign Inktomi employees dedicated to maintenance duties hereunder. Additional Inktomi employees may be required to be assigned to maintenance duties hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the mention of Exhibit D and the requirement for Microsoft's approval for replacements, the clause becomes significantly weaker. This creates a contradiction with other sections that might rely on dedicated and qualified staff, as the contract now lacks a specific commitment to two full-time employees, and gives Inktomi the unilateral right to appoint or reappoint staff.

("Exodus"), Inktomi will locate the Hosting Servers at the facilities of Exodus, and Exodus will provide power and Internet telecommunications services to the Hosting Servers. However, Microsoft will have no obligations or liabilities to Exodus, Inktomi will remain liable for providing all 6 Services to Microsoft notwithstanding its arrangement with Exodus, and Inktomi will [*] and [*] against from any and all [*] to [*] (in accordance with the procedures specified in Section [*] below). A copy of the contract(s) between Inktomi and Exodus is/are attached hereto as Exhibit [*], and Inktomi shall not modify said contract(s) or replace Exodus as its subcontractor for the applicable services (including without limitation by having Inktomi perform the Services directly) without Microsoft's prior written approval (which approval Microsoft agrees to not unreasonably withhold). Inktomi shall provide Exodus with a copy of the Security Measures applicable under this Agreement and will use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that Exodus strictly adheres to all such Security Measures.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2 Inktomi will locate the Hosting Servers at a facility of its choosing. Inktomi will remain liable for providing all Services to Microsoft. Inktomi shall provide security measures to ensure proper use.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit mention of Exodus Communications, the commitment to a specific facility and the required Microsoft approval, the hosting arrangements become more ambiguous. Furthermore, the removal of the obligation to provide Exodus with the Security Measures creates an internal inconsistency, because previous sections still talk about the 'Security Measures' but the contract no longer ensures that the hosting provider is bound to them.
